issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: This may involve statically-linking (or bundling where shared libs makes sense) the various required dependencies with {{libarrow_flight.so}} in the manylinux1 wheel build
fields.summary: [Python] Ship Flight-enabled Python wheels on Linux and Windows

comments.body: We should link dynamically. With the correct RPATH settings this is the better solution. See boost as an example
gRPC build does not create shared libraries so there are many layers to this onion
I don't see this as necessarily a priority for 0.13 given the alpha-ness of the protocol. I definitely want this to be building on Windows in the next week or two. Thoughts?

Once the CMake refactor is through and Flight builds on Windows, it should not be hard to add this to the wheels. We should as always start with the Linux wheels as they have the most sophisticated build infrastructure (and thus adding a feature is simpler and more reliable).
OK. I'll try to get Windows working this week
Since I don't think I am going to have Windows working in time for 0.13 I'm going to move this to 0.14.0 so we can continue to get Flight hardened for that release
If you do manage to get Flight into the Linux and macOS wheels then great, but Windows will have to wait =)
Once it's solved, ARROW-5441 may help here.
Also, Flight support on Windows (ARROW-3294) should soon be done.
I would be hesitant to release without Flight in the wheel installers
